sense.name: be contiguous to or on the border of
sense.commentary: NOTE: Use for senses where two objects are contiguous but one object does not surround the other.
sense.examples: To the south, it borders Andalusia. Coyoacan, a long-standing Nahua town, borders the lake. Rest areas and information kiosks will border these important arterials.

sense.name: create an edge or border
sense.commentary: NOTE: Use for senses where one object surrounds the other.
sense.examples: She bordered the edges in garter stitch to keep them from rolling up. This cotton edging bordered the sides of the flag. Tulips bordered the front yard.

sense.name: verge on, approach
sense.examples: That suggestion borders on lunacy! Her lines were cheesy, but she bordered on funny.
